Is a town and a former municipality on the island of Rhodes, in the Dodecanese, Greece. It is the second-largest town on the island of Rhodes. It has a population of approximately 12,000, and is located eight kilometres west of the town of Rhodes, the island's capital, on the island's northwestern coast. Blue waters, a seemingly endless organized beach, the pleasant cool summer climate and mild winters, big hotel complexes as well as smaller friendly ones, shops of all kinds, and many night-clubs all contribute to make lalysos bay one of the most popular resorts on the island. Thanks to the ideal conditions of the region, important international windsurfing competitions often take place here.

value: content= A five star all inclusive hotel, situated on the western coast of Rhodes, consists of two buildings, twenty meters away from the sea front and very near the village of Trianta.
content=Owned and run by the Douka family, Hotel Villas Duc reflects her values and philosophy: hospitality, service and respect of the guests in a warm and friendly environment.
